page.title: 01A GENERAL REVIEW OF HARBURY
page.content: Harbury is near the centre of England, on a hill in fairly rolling countryside. It has a population of about 2500. It is about 7 miles from Leamington, 4 from Southam, l5 from Coventry. It is a commuter village; most men work in Leamington. The majority of mothers work too. There are 8 shops, 6 pubs, and a bank. There is a bus service, though nearly all journeys out of the village are made by car. Only accommodation is the Caravan Club Site at Cottage Close. The village is surrounded by agricultural land. Places of interest locally include Warwick and the Castle, Kenilworth Castle, Leamington, Stratford and more locally, Chesterton Windmill.
